p: In 2016, all ten bumble bees ( Bombus balteatus queens) captured while foraging on Polemonium flowers in four geographically isolated populations carried Salix pollen. Polemonium plants located near flowering Salix had stigma pollen loads with average contamination levels ranging from 4% to 25% among sites ( F = 5.811, df = 3, p = .00099; Fig. 4). Proximity to willows had a negligible impact on contamination (distance F = 0.1355, df = 1, p = .71 regardless of site (for site by distance interaction, F = 1.3344, df = 3, p = .2668).
